intro: Polygala vollii, commonly known as the velvet tassel or velvet tassel bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its unique, often hairy or velvety inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in whorls, and are typically blue, purple, or white in color. Polygala vollii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
